sentences: Kevin Ian Simm (born 5 September 1980, Chorley, Lancashire, England) is an English pop singer.
He won The Voice UK on 9 April 2016.
Simm was in the group Liberty X from 2001 until their split in 2007 and is currently the lead singer of the group Wet Wet Wet.
Simm was in the group Liberty X from 2001 until their split in 2007 and is currently the lead singer of the group Wet Wet Wet.
Simm was in the group Liberty X from 2001 until their split in 2007 and is currently the lead singer of the group Wet Wet Wet.
Simm was born on 5 September 1980 in Chorley, Lancashire, England.
He attended St Anne's Primary School then St. Mary's Catholic Technology College in Leyland between 1991 and 1996, where he showed promise as a junior footballer.
In his last year in secondary school, he performed Elton John's "Daniel" in the school's annual show.

After a few years of writing and performing on the northern pubs and clubs circuit, as well as spending a summer season in a band called Force 5 with James Fox, Simm auditioned for the ITV reality TV show, Popstars.

After a few years of writing and performing on the northern pubs and clubs circuit, as well as spending a summer season in a band called Force 5 with James Fox, Simm auditioned for the ITV reality TV show, Popstars.
2001–07: Popstars and Liberty X

Shortly after forming, Liberty received a legal challenge in the UK High Court from a funk R&B band, also called "Liberty", who achieved success in the 1990s, including being awarded Capital Radio Band of the Year, playing Wembley Arena, European tours and the release of albums in the US, Europe and UK.

Shortly after forming, Liberty received a legal challenge in the UK High Court from a funk R&B band, also called "Liberty", who achieved success in the 1990s, including being awarded Capital Radio Band of the Year, playing Wembley Arena, European tours and the release of albums in the US, Europe and UK.
The final judgment was in favour of the funk R&B band and the ex-Popstars then asked readers of UK tabloid newspaper, The Sun to suggest a new name.
Liberty X enjoyed seven Top 10 singles from 2001 to 2005.
Their biggest hit, "Just a Little", reached Number 1 in May
Their debut album, Thinking It Over, reached Number 3 in June 2002.
The group split in 2007 following disappointing album and singles sales from their third studio album.
In 2005, Simm appeared on The Games, winning a silver medal and featuring with convicted Who Wants to Be a Millionaire?
2007–15: Solo career and reformation of Liberty X

sentences: In 2015, during his audition for The Voice UK, Simm revealed that he left Liberty X as he felt the group were officially over.

sentences: In 2016, Simm auditioned for the fifth series of The Voice UK singing a soulful version of Sia's "Chandelier".
He won the knockouts and won the final of The Voice UK on 9 April.

On 28 May 2016 Simm rejoined Liberty X performing at Birmingham Gay Pride performing hits "Got to Have Your Love", "Holding on for You", "Being Nobody", Song 4 Lovers and "Just a Little and the winner single "All You Good Friends".
On 25 September 2018, it was announced that Simm would join Scottish band Wet Wet Wet as the new lead singer, replacing former member Marti Pellow.
He started singing with the band at 2 shows, St Lukes in Calton, Glasgow and The Venue in London in November 2018.
Simm married his long-term girlfriend Laura in June 2008 in his hometown Chorley.
They have two sons – Charles, born in April 2012, and Oliver, born in November 2013.
